Name: Absentation
Definition: One of the members of a family absents himself from home.

Name: Interdiction
Definition: An interdiction is addressed to the hero.

Name: Violation
Definition: The interdiction is violated.

Name: Reconnaissance
Definition: The villain makes an attempt at reconnaissance.

Name: Delivery
Definition: The villain receives information about his victim.

Name: Trickery
Definition: The villain attempts to deceive his victim in order to take possession of him or of his belongings.

Name: Complicity
Definition: Victim submits to deception and thereby unwittingly helps his enemy.

Name: Villainy
Definition: The villain causes harm or injury to a member of a family.

Name: Lack
Definition: A member of a family lacks something or desires to have something.

Name: Meditation
Definition: Misfortune or lack is made known; the hero is approached with a request or command; he is allowed to go or he is dispatched.

Name: Beginning counteraction
Definition: The hero agrees to or decides upon counteraction.

Name: Departure
Definition: The hero leaves home.

Name: First function of the Donor
Definition: The hero is tested, interrogated, attacked etc., which prepares the way for his receiving either a magical agent or a helper.

Name: The hero’s reaction
Definition: The hero reacts to the actions of the future Donor.

Name: Provision of a magical agent
Definition: The hero acquires the use of a magical agent.

Name: Guidance
Definition: Hero is led to the whereabouts of an object of search.

Name: Struggle
Definition: The hero and the villain join in direct combat.

Name: Branding
Definition: The hero is branded.

Name: Victory
Definition: The villain is defeated.

Name: Liquidation of Lack
Definition: The initial misfortune or lack is liquidated.

Name: Return
Definition: The hero returns.

Name: Pursuit
Definition: The hero is pursued.

Name: Rescue
Definition: Rescue of the hero from pursuit.

Name: Unrecognized arrival
Definition: Unrecognized, he arrives home or in another country.

Name: Unfounded claims
Definition: A false hero presents unfounded claims.

Name: Difficult task
Definition: A difficult task is proposed to the hero.

Name: Solution
Definition: The task is resolved.

Name: Recognised
Definition: The hero is recognised.

Name: Exposure
Definition: The false hero or villain is exposed.

Name: Transfiguration
Definition: The hero is given a new appearance.

Name: Punishment
Definition: The villain is punished.

Name: Wedding
Definition: The hero is married and ascends the throne.
